children.desc: Form a traditional water bomb base
Fold from corner to corner.
Fold the bottom left corner to the top right.
Unfold
Fold the bottom right corner to the top left.
Unfold
Fold from edge to edge.
Fold the left edge to the right.
Unfold
Fold the bottom edge to the top.
Unfold
Form the waterbomb base by collapsing the sides.
Collapse every flap into a tall diamond shape.
Collapse the front flaps.
Fold top edges to the middle on the front two flaps.
Fold left flap to the middle
Fold right flap to the middle
Unfold
Collapse the left flap.
Fold the left flap up so it's easier to see.
Collapse the flap into a diamond shape.
Fold the newly collapsed flap in half.
Collapse the right flap.
Fold the right flap up so it's easier to see.
Collapse the flap into a diamond shape.
Fold the newly collapsed flap in half.
Collapse the back flaps.
Fold top edges to the middle on the back two flaps.
Fold left flap to the middle
Fold right flap to the middle
Unfold
Collapse the left flap.
Fold the left flap up so it's easier to see.
Collapse the flap into a diamond shape.
Fold the newly collapsed flap in half.
Collapse the right flap.
Fold the right flap up so it's easier to see.
Collapse the flap into a diamond shape.
Fold the newly collapsed flap in half.
Form crease along middle of model
Fold the whole model in half.
Fold the whole model in half and crease in the other direction.
Unfold.
Fold in the edges of the open side to slim the petals.
Fold in edges of the front flap.
Fold in the front flap
Unfold.
Fold the middle point up, creating new creases and a new diamond shape.
Fold the new triangular flap back down.
Fold in edges of the back flap.
Fold in the back flap
Unfold.
Fold the middle point down, creating new creases and a new diamond shape.
Fold the new triangular flap back down.
Fold along the center to 'open new flaps'; keep going for two flaps, so that new petal faces are shown.
Fold in edges of the new front flap.
Fold in the new front flap
Unfold.
Fold the middle point up, creating new creases and a new diamond shape.
Fold the new triangular flap back down.
Fold in edges of the new back flap.
Fold in the new back flap
Unfold.
Fold the middle point down, creating new creases and a new diamond shape.
Fold the new triangular flap back down.
Change front and back flaps one to the left, opening new flat, tall faces.
Slim the body of the flower by folding all bottom edges of flaps to the midline.
Fold the front face's bottom edges to the midline.
Fold the back face's bottom edges to the midline.
Change front and back flaps two to the left, opening new flat, tall faces.
Fold the front face's bottom edges to the midline.
Fold the back face's bottom edges to the midline.
Give it the final touches, expanding into a square based flower shape with petals.
Expand the flower into a square based pyramid by folding all the tall flaps flat.
Fold the petals down. Try curling them with a pencil or finger too!
